comments:
eclipse.buildId=M200409161125

Sometimes when moving a class from one package to another, which is currently
open in the editor, an error condition arises whereby 
i) The IDE pops up an error box saying "The file has been deleted from the
filesystem, do you want to close the editor window"
ii) Whichever option you select, the resulting editor window becomes "dead" - it
will no longer repaint, although it can be closed with the X button.
iii) All further attempts to perform the same type of operation (moving classes
between packages) will fail with the following NPE:

[This seems to be some unpredictable race condition, occurs about 1 time in 10
on my system]

Error Nov 12, 2004 15:51:40.354 java.lang.NullPointerException

Move to Platform/Text for comments

Do you have more info? Other entries in .log (see also bug 77962). 

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 77962 ***
